projectPurpose: A scientific/mathematical calculator with advanced features and graphing capabilities, designed for a terminal user interface.

alternatives.name: SciPy (with NumPy)
mainFeatures: Fundamental package for scientific computing with Python
Modules for optimization, linear algebra, integration, etc. (SciPy)
Extensive libraries for mathematical and scientific routines
Integrates with plotting libraries like Matplotlib

alternatives.name: Julia
mainFeatures: Strong support for numerical and scientific computing
Functions for matrix manipulation and data visualization

alternatives.name: Wolfram Alpha
mainFeatures: Answers factual queries and performs calculations
Supports complex numbers, vectors, matrices, graphing

alternatives.name: MATLAB
mainFeatures: Designed for matrix manipulations and numerical computing
Interactive environment and GUI development tools

alternatives.name: Kalker
mainFeatures: Supports complex numbers, vectors, and matrices

alternatives.name: Euler Mathematical Toolbox
mainFeatures: Supports real, complex, and interval numbers, vectors, matrices

marketPositioning: kalc is positioned as a powerful, open-source scientific calculator focusing on a terminal user interface (TUI). It targets users who need advanced mathematical capabilities, including complex numbers, vector/matrix operations, arbitrary precision, and 2D/3D graphing, all accessible from the command line. While more comprehensive mathematical software like MATLAB, Octave, or the Python scientific stack offer similar computational power and graphing (usually in a GUI or scripting environment), and TUI calculators like Kalker provide a command-line interface with some advanced features, kalc carves a niche by combining a rich set of advanced mathematical functions and graphing within a performant, real-time TUI, distinguishing itself from both simpler TUI calculators and more complex, GUI-dependent mathematical environments.
